catalog.title: Intro to Weight Training
catalog.description: This class is designed to introduce students to weight training, specifically lifting technique. Through this course, students will build a strong understanding about the fundamental principles of weight training and demonstrate competency in applying this know ledge to personal weight training practice. Students will leave the class with lifelong understanding of how to develop a personal lifting plan.

catalog.title: Lifeguarding Instructor
catalog.description: The American Red Cross Lifeguard Instructor course trains instructor candidates to teach American Red Cross Lifeguarding, Shallow Water Lifeguarding, Aquatic Attraction Lifeguarding, Waterfront Skills, Waterpark Skills, First Aid, CPR/AED for Professional Rescuers, Administrating Emergency Oxygen and Bloodborne Pathogens. This course prepares instructor candidates to use course and presentation materials, conduct training sessions and evaluate the progress of candidates in a professional-level course
catalog.subject: Recreation Instruction
catalog.requisites_description: Pre-Requisite: Complete online portion of the Lifeguarding Instructor course through the American Red Cross (prior to the first day of class); Be at least 17 years of age; Possess a current Red Cross certification in Lifeguarding/First Aid/CPR/AED.

catalog.title: Introduction to Triathlon
catalog.description: Triathlon training is a one credit intensive conditioning program using a cross training approach to achieve a high level of personal fitness.  The emphasis will be on skill development in the areas of swimming, biking and running to prepare students for a triathlon event.  The course will incorporate a variety of training methods to ensure a smooth and progressive development of individual cardiovascular fitness.  REC courses were formally ATH (Athletics courses).
catalog.subject: Recreation Instruction

catalog.title: Intermediate Swimming
catalog.description: Elements of good swimming; whole stroke; increased endurance; versatility. (ARC certification available.) There is a fee associated with this class.  REC courses were formerly ATH (Athletics courses).

catalog.title: Introduction to Diving
catalog.description: This is an introduction to beginning diving in which a student will learn proper technique and safety using both the one and three meter diving boards. The course will include forward, backward, reverse and inward dive categories. Diving combines physical and mental skills that students will use throughout their lives. Diving skills give a person independence and provide a foundation for safe participation in other water activities. Although the objective of diving is to learn new dives, there is always an enjoyment of being in the water. Diving is a fun lifetime sport for people of all fitness levels.

notes.note:
.Recreation Course fees were implemented fall 2015.  Recreation provides approximately 80 academic courses each semester, as well as online courses during winter and summer sessions.  Fiscally, more than 3,500 students participate in physical activity and wellness classes.  UB has a long history of providing physical activity and wellness classes, dating back to the 1987. 
Since 1987, Recreation Services has expanded course offerings in order to continue to challenge and accommodate UB¿s diverse student population. The continuation of physical activity and wellness classes through Recreation Services is dependent upon the student population, UB facility, instructional staff and supporting staff.  Several courses including swimming based classes require supporting staff to manage and provide safety to Alumni Arena and Clark Hall pools.  Lifeguards and TA¿s for swimming classes REC 119, 120, 121, 122, and 125 provide a safe environment for students to learn how to swim or to enhance current swimming level. REC 122 and REC 125, two certifying courses provide certifications through the American Red Cross (ARC) for lifeguarding and water safety instruction.
Recreation course fees for REC 119, 120, 121, 122 and 125 cover the costs of lifeguards for each course and the certifications for REC 122 and 125.  The following courses are assigned course fees:
REC 119 Beginner Swim (7-week course)- Aquatics Course Lifeguard Fee $16.00
REC 120 Intermediate Swimming (7-week course) ¿ Aquatic Course Lifeguard Fee $16.00
REC 121 Advanced Beginner Swim (7-week course) ¿ Aquatic Course Lifeguard Fee $16.00
REC 122 Lifeguard Training (7-week course) ¿ Lifeguard Certification Fee (ARC) $55.50
REC 125 Water Safety Instruction (15-week course) ¿ Water Safety Instruction (ARC) $37.50

catalog.title: Lifeguard Training
catalog.description: Lifeguard training teaches the student/candidate to prevent, prepare for and respond to emergencies in aquatic settings. Students also learn CPR and AED skills. Strong swimming skills are a must. There is a fee associated with this class.  REC courses were formerly ATH (Athletics courses).

notes.note: This class is designed to help prepare the student for challenge style races/Obstacle Course Races. Such races, including Spartan, Tough Mudder, Warrior Dash, BattleFrog and others- include obstacles and activities beyond running. The goal of this class is to build stamina and increase fitness so that students can consider participation in Challenge/OCR events. While the class is mostly running; Additional activities such as push-ups, sit-ups, bear crawl and swimming are all included.

catalog.title: Power Yoga
catalog.description: The emphasis of the class will be on asanas (poses) and vinyasa (flow) for increased flexibility, improved health, relaxation, and reduced stress in daily living.  Class participants will also be exposed to the language and concepts of Yoga.  A typical class will include breathing techniques and asana practice, which focus on balancing and inverted poses  REC courses were formerly ATH (Athletics courses)

catalog.title: Restorative Yoga
catalog.description: This class is designed to introduce students to restorative yoga, a method of bringing deep relaxation to the body and mind through specific postures and techniques. Through this course, students will learn poses that calm the mind, body, and nervous system, as well as utilize props to support and relax the body. Poses are held for longer periods which, allow muscles to relax deeply under the support of props. Restorative yoga is a practice that can help to balance an active lifestyle and schedule.
catalog.subject: Recreation Instruction

catalog.title: First Aid Personal Safety
catalog.description: Theory and practice of first aid for the injured. Students will receive national certification in first aid, CPR, and AED use upon completion of the class. REC courses were formerly ATH (Athletics courses).
catalog.subject: Recreation Instruction

catalog.title: First Aid Personal Safety
catalog.description: Theory and practice of first aid for the injured. Students will receive national certification in first aid, CPR, and AED use upon completion of the class. REC courses were formerly ATH (Athletics courses).
catalog.subject: Recreation Instruction

catalog.title: Group Fitness Inst.Training
catalog.description: This course is designed to give students the knowledge and understanding necessary to prepare for the ACE Group Fitness Instructor Certification exam and become effective group fitness instructors. Through this course a student will learn basic human anatomy and exercise physiology specific to group fitness instruction, principles of class preparation, class formatting, group exercise program design, how to teach group exercise classes, emergency procedures in a group fitness setting, and the business of group fitness. This class will also teach and train students through a 7-week group fitness shadowing and practicum. This course is the same as ES 191 and course repeat rules will apply.  Students should consult with their major department regarding any restrictions on their degree requirements.
catalog.subject: Recreation Instruction

catalog.title: Group Fitness Inst.Training
catalog.description: This course is designed to give students the knowledge and understanding necessary to prepare for the ACE Group Fitness Instructor Certification exam and become effective group fitness instructors. Through this course a student will learn basic human anatomy and exercise physiology specific to group fitness instruction, principles of class preparation, class formatting, group exercise program design, how to teach group exercise classes, emergency procedures in a group fitness setting, and the business of group fitness. This class will also teach and train students through a 7-week group fitness shadowing and practicum. This course is the same as ES 191 and course repeat rules will apply.  Students should consult with their major department regarding any restrictions on their degree requirements.

catalog.description: Introduces the importance and holistic natures of the six dimensions of personal wellness and fitness.  The opportunity for students to assess their current wellness and health status will be offered during lab.  REC courses were formerly ATH (Athletics courses).
